result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander R Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment and counseling needs.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with Mary Fisher.  

No contact with the victim in 15CF220, unless his agent pre-approves, and the victim requests contact.
May apply for expungement, if he successfully completes probation.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first 6 months of probation.

DNA Proof of Submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Victim notification complied with.   Defendant plead no contest to count 3 in 15CF136, count 2 in 15CF220,  and Count 1 in  16CF226.   Remaining counts in each case are dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes, including citation numbers:  15TR2690,15TR2691 and 15TR2692.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Court gave defendant the felony warnings.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Poss of Narcotic drugs, contrary to 961.41(3g)(am) in 15CF136, and Theft, movable property contrary to 943.20(1)(a) in 15CF220 and Resist/Obstruct, contrary to 946.41(1) in 16CF226.  Joint recommendation:  probation 3, years.  DNA sample.  No contact with the victim.  No contact with M.F.  Restitution, plus surcharge.  LOA to victim, to be preapproved by the agent.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA and recom.  60 hours CS within 6 m.  o/m employment.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  May apply to expungement if he successfully completes probation.   

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation, concurrent.  No contact with the victim, unless agent approves and the victim requests.  No contact with M. F.  $2159.91, restitution, plus surcharge.  Pay monthly through probation.  LOA to victim of not less than 500 words,  to be pre-approved by the agent.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. Subject to random testing by his agent.   AODA and recommended treatment.   60 hours community service due within the first 6 months of probation.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment/counseling needs.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  CC

from Palm Partners
Status conference at 01-04-2016 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant did not appear.  Attorney Poss appeared.  Defendant accepted into treatment in Florida.  Attorney Poss may make arrangements for defendant appear by telephone for the arraignment.  STC 1/4/16 at 3 pm.  How long will defendant be there?  Can remove if court gets information from Attorney Poss.

Mr Wallace called back at 10:03 a.m. to inform the court he will not be able to make it to court; he will be leaving to Florida today he left a message with the PD office reason why; he did state he spoke with Poss this morning and thought he would make it but he will not.

Alexander called @ 9:40 a.m. to state he is trying to get a hold of his atty. not able to at this point. Mr Wallace stated he was unable to attend court today did not give a reason; I asked that he call the PD office to leave message and keep trying to contact Atty Poss, explained the court may issue a warrant if he FTA.

ADA files an Information.  Attorney Poss requests this case be scheduled for an arraignment.  Court scheduled arraignment for 12-14-15 at 10:30.  TR cases will track with the CF case.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel SPD William Poss.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defense waives reading of the complaint and states he has advised his client of the right to have a preliminary hearing within the time limits and he wishes to waive the time limits.  Judge reviews that right with defendant and finds he knowingly, freely, and intelligently waiving his right to preliminary hearing within time limits.  Court set pretrial for 10-7 at 10:00 and a status conference for 10-26 at 3:00.  His address is correct and bond is continued.
